caption:
This aerial photograph depicts a coastal urban area with a prominent body of water. The water is a deep blue color, and several docks and piers extend into it. On one of the piers, there is notable construction or industrial activity, indicated by the presence of cranes and piles of materials. Additionally, there are small boats visible nearby on the water.

Towards the middle right of the image, there is a waterfront area with small green spaces, walkways, and some buildings close to the edge. Some structures appear to be related to marine or harbor activities, possibly including a lighthouse or navigation aids.

The background of the photo shows a dense urban landscape with numerous buildings, defining a city skyline. There are clusters of high-rise buildings suggesting a downtown area. The city is surrounded by roads and patches of greenery, illustrating the blend of urban and landscaped environments.

Furthermore, the top left section of the photograph reveals another part of the city, separated by a wide road or highway. This part also features buildings, green areas, and is crisscrossed by several roads. Overall, the photograph captures a bustling city scene from an elevated viewpoint, highlighting interactions between urban developments and waterfront activities.
title: Buffalo waterfront at the point where the badly polluted Buffalo River flows into Lake Erie. Aerial view shows the discolored water as it moves toward the Niagara River and the famous falls.
